DOCNAME: CASE OF NURİ KURT v. TURKEY
CONCLUSION: No violation of Art. 8;No violation of P1-1;Not necessary to examine Art. 6-1;Violation of Art. 13;No violation of Art. 14;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP citizen who was born in DATE and currently lives in GPE , GPE . Until DATE the applicant lived in GPE , a village of the GPE district in the province of ORG .

CARDINAL . The application concerns the alleged destruction of the applicant ’s house by State security forces and village guards , and the national authorities’ refusal to allow the applicant to return to his village .
CARDINAL . The facts surrounding the alleged destruction of the applicant ’s house and his inability to return to his village are in dispute between the parties .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE a landmine placed on the road to PERSON , a neighbouring village of GPE , exploded and caused the death of a number of village guards . Security forces from ORG in GPE and village guards from the PERSON village accused the inhabitants of ORG of perpetrating the explosion since they had refused to serve as village guards . They threatened to evacuate the village unless the inhabitants left their homes within DATE . Along with a number of fellow villagers , the applicant left his home and moved to ORG where he currently lives .

CARDINAL . Sometime in DATE or DATE , village guards from the PERSON village burned the villagers’ crops in GPE . During the incident , a small number of houses caught fire , although the applicant ’s house remained intact .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date , the applicant learned through his acquaintances that on DATE , DATE before the general elections , security forces and village guards had set fire to his house , along with all other houses in the village .

CARDINAL . NORP Immediately after the burning of the village , the security forces and village guards arrived in PERSON , a neighbouring village . They required the villagers to assemble in the village square and threatened to burn the houses in PERSON too if the villagers were to vote for ORG ( ORG ) in the forthcoming elections .

CARDINAL . This letter informed all village mayors in ORG about the policy set for an orderly return to the villages previously abandoned because of terrorism . It stated that all villagers were free to return to the villages found suitable for habitation by the respective ORG .

CARDINAL . The letter divided villages into CARDINAL categories in respect of the permitted time for such returns . It gave no indication as to which village fell under which “ phase ” . It explained that the former inhabitants of certain “ phase - II villages ” could return to those villages only for cultivation purposes during DATE . The letter did not contain any indication about the phase / category in which ORG falls .

CARDINAL . According to the letter , no villager was allowed to resettle in or stay TIME in “ phase - II ” and “ phase - III ” villages until a decision had been taken by the respective governor ’s office to that effect .

It explained that during such operations it was difficult to distinguish terrorists from the villagers wandering around in rural areas . The letter advised that notice be given to villagers to avoid any unfortunate incident for which the authorities would not accept any responsibility .

CARDINAL . In DATE , PERSON was a fire fighter in PERSON . He and his colleague , Mr PERSON , were on duty when the fire started in ORG and its vicinity . He and his colleagues immediately rushed to ORG as soon as they heard about the fire from the Mayor ’s office . Mr Kaya was driving the fire engine , accompanied by PERSON . By the time they arrived , the flames had already surrounded the entire village of GPE . In the meantime , village guards came out to help . It was impossible to cut through the flames surrounding the village . As a matter of priority , they strived to extinguish the utility poles . Before long they ran out of water and were unable to quench the flames , which eventually burned down ORG and the cultivated lands attached to it . Mr Kaya pointed out that he had not seen any military vehicles or gendarmes at the site of the fire . He added that the village guards had made every effort to fight the fire .

CARDINAL . Mr GPE was a resident of the NORP village of GPE . He stated that the inhabitants of ORG had left their homes due to ORG coercion . When he had heard about the fire , he and his fellow villagers had gone to ORG on tractors . They assisted the fire fighters and the village guards to put out the fire . The fire spread very quickly because of the strong wind and burned down ORG and some parts of the neighbouring villages of FAC . The witness did not hear any rumour that security forces and village guards had started the fire . He explained that the village guards were making every effort to fight the fire . This witness also believed that the fire had started due to the burning of wheat stubble .

CARDINAL . Mr GPE lived in the PERSON hamlet of LOC . Like the Government ’s other witnesses , PERSON stated that , together with a group of fellow villagers , he had rushed to ORG by tractor when he had heard about the fire . The fighters and village guards had made every effort to extinguish the fire which had been spread by a strong wind . The witness had never heard a rumour that security forces and village guards had started the fire .

CARDINAL . Mr PERSON was the head of the village guards in LOC at the relevant time , and resided in the PERSON hamlet of ORG . This witness stated that the inhabitants of ORG had left their homes in DATE as a result of ORG coercion and intimidation , and that the applicant had chosen to move to ORG . He noted that the applicant ’s land was being cultivated by CARDINAL farmers from GPE , Mr PERSON and Mr PERSON . Accordingly , the applicant was not denied either the economic use of his land or access thereto .

CARDINAL . The witnesses lived in the GPE hamlet of GPE in GPE . They had been breeding livestock in the applicant ’s village for DATE . Seeing that there was no farming activity on the applicant ’s land , the witnesses offered to cultivate his fields in return for a share of the crop . The witnesses agreed with the applicant on a verbal basis and have been cultivating his fields DATE .
CARDINAL . The witnesses claimed that ORG security forces and village guards had not in any way exerted pressure on them or prevented them from cultivating the applicant ’s fields .
